author: Various

title: Kidnapped
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: They were not two hundred yards away, when there came a third great sea;and at that the brig lifted clean over the reef; her canvas filled fora moment, and she seemed to sail in chase of them, but settling all thewhile; and presently she drew down and down, as if a hand was drawingher; and the sea closed over the Covenant of Dysart.

title: Kidnapped
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: "Mr. Riach," said the captain, "this night's work must never be kenntin Dysart.

title: Kidnapped
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: We were then passing, it appeared, within some miles of Dysart,where the brig was built, and where old Mrs. Hoseason, the captain'smother, had come some years before to live; and whether outward orinward bound, the Covenant was never suffered to go by that place byday, without a gun fired and colours shown.

title: Kidnapped
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: "You see, Davie," resumed my uncle, as soon as he saw that I had done,"I have a venture with this man Hoseason, the captain of a trading brig,the Covenant, of Dysart.

title: Brown heath and blue bells :

snippet: At Dysart the train leaves the coast and trends northward  through meadows that are fresh with verdure, and among graceful hills, crowned with green copses, and now beginning to glitter in the brilliant autumn sun.

title: A brief account of a tour through some parts of Scotland
author: Hunter, Robert
snippet: After passing Dysart and Kirkcaldy, whichlie at the mouth of the Forth, or what iscalled the Firth of Forth, Ave reached Pettycur, where Ave got on board a steamer, andin less than an hour reached NeAAiiaA-en,—the distance across being seven miles : and inanother quarter of an hour, we again placedour feet on the streets of the metropolis.

snippet: The coast on the north side of the Forth is closelydotted with villages and large princely mansionsfrom Fifeness up to Burntisland, among othersbeing Macduff Castle, Wemyss Castle, with thevillages of Dysart, Leven, East Wemyss, WestWemyss, Kirkcaldy, &c.
